availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert A. Seay (Louisville, Kentucky, saddler and policeman)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, saddler, and policeman. Virginia native. Son of Leonard Seay and Lucy Seay. Married to Mary Seay. Father of Rosa Seay, George Seay, Sallie Lou Seay, and Sue Seay. Saddler in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Policeman in Louisville in 1852. Policeman in Louisville in 1860. Employed Bridget Kelly as a domestic worker in Louisville in 1860. Policeman in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 3, p. 273B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 819.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 5, p. 115.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 53 A.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 220.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994041, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 8.
”The Case Against Bernstein, Rosenbaum, and Goldburg.” The Louisville Daily Courier. (Louisville, KY). Jan. 19, 1860.
”Arrested by Death.” The Courier-Journal. (Louisville, KY). Aug. 19, 1891.
